Quelle d√©cision prend-on au niveau \(\alpha=1\%\)?

 On rejette \(H_0\) car la p-valeur est sup√©rieure √† \(0.05\). On ne peut pas conclure ce test au niveau de \(1\%\). On rejette \(H_0\) car la p-valeur est inf√©rieure √† \(1\%\).  Non, ce n'est pas une bonne pratique. Oui, tant que cela permet d'obtenir une conclusion. Oui, si le test est correctement justifi√© ensuite. Cela d√©pend du contexte. Cela est acceptable en recherche exploratoire.

title: Webexercises
text:
This is a Web Exercise template created by the psychology teaching team at the University of Glasgow, based on ideas from Software Carpentry. This template shows how instructors can easily create interactive web documents that students can use in self-guided learning.
The {webexercises} package provides a number of functions that you use in inline R code or through code chunk options to create HTML widgets (text boxes, pull down menus, buttons that reveal hidden content). Examples are given below. Render this file to HTML to see how it works.
NOTE: To use the widgets in the compiled HTML file, you need to have a JavaScript-enabled browser.

title: Webexercises
text:
Example Questions

Fill-In-The-Blanks (fitb())
Create fill-in-the-blank questions using fitb(), providing the answer as the first argument.

The blanks are case-sensitive; if you don‚Äôt care about case, use the argument ignore_case = TRUE.

If you want to ignore differences in whitespace use, use the argument ignore_ws = TRUE (which is the default) and include spaces in your answer anywhere they could be acceptable.

Longer MCQs (longmcq())
When your answers are very long, sometimes a drop-down select box gets formatted oddly. You can use longmcq() to deal with this. Since the answers are long, It‚Äôs probably best to set up the options inside an R chunk with echo=FALSE.
What is a p-value?

 the probability that the null hypothesis is true the probability of the observed, or more extreme, data, under the assumption that the null-hypothesis is true the probability of making an error in your conclusion

What is true about a 95% confidence interval of the mean?

 there is a 95% probability that the true mean lies within this range 95% of the data fall within this range if you repeated the process many times, 95% of intervals calculated in this way contain the true mean

text:
Hidden solutions and hints
You can fence off a solution area that will be hidden behind a button using hide() before the solution and unhide() after, each as inline R code. Pass the text you want to appear on the button to the hide() function.
If the solution is a code chunk, instead of using hide() and unhide(), simply set the webex.hide chunk option to TRUE, or set it to the string you wish to display on the button.

title: Cours Semaine 1
text: It appears you don‚Äôt have a PDF plugin. You can download the PDF.

title: Introduction √† la Statistique
text:
Ce cours introduit les notions fondamentales de la statistique √† travers trois axes principaux. Le premier axe porte sur les probabilit√©s. Nous explorons les r√®gles √©l√©mentaires permettant de quantifier l‚Äôincertitude et d‚Äôassocier une probabilit√© √† divers √©v√©nements. Le deuxi√®me axe est consacr√© aux statistiques descriptives. L‚Äôobjectif est ici de r√©sumer et de visualiser un √©chantillon de donn√©es afin d‚Äôen faciliter l‚Äôinterpr√©tation. Enfin, le troisi√®me axe traite de la statistique inf√©rentielle. Nous utilisons des mod√®les statistiques pour formuler des hypoth√®ses et prendre des d√©cisions √† partir d‚Äôun √©chantillon de donn√©es.
Le contenu pr√©sent√© sur ce site a √©t√© principalement d√©velopp√© par St√©phane Guerrier, Mucyo Karemera, Samuel Orso et Lionel Voirol.

title: Webexercises
text:
This is a Web Exercise template created by the #PsyTeachR team at the University of Glasgow, based on ideas from Software Carpentry. This template shows how instructors can easily create interactive web documents that students can use in self-guided learning.
The {webexercises} package provides a number of functions that you use in inline R code or through code chunk options to create HTML widgets (text boxes, pull down menus, buttons that reveal hidden content). Examples are given below. Render this file to HTML to see how it works.
NOTE: To use the widgets in the compiled HTML file, you need to have a JavaScript-enabled browser.

title: Webexercises
text:
Example Questions

Fill-In-The-Blanks (fitb())
Create fill-in-the-blank questions using fitb(), providing the answer as the first argument.

2 + 2 is 

You can also create these questions dynamically, using variables from your R session.

The square root of 49 is: 

The blanks are case-sensitive; if you don‚Äôt care about case, use the argument ignore_case = TRUE.

What is the letter after D? 

If you want to ignore differences in whitespace use, use the argument ignore_ws = TRUE (which is the default) and include spaces in your answer anywhere they could be acceptable.

How do you load the tidyverse package? 

You can set more than one possible correct answer by setting the answers as a vector.

Type a vowel: 

You can use regular expressions to test answers against more complex rules.

Type any 3 letters: 



Multiple Choice (mcq())

‚ÄúNever gonna give you up, never gonna: let you goturn you downrun awaylet you down‚Äù
‚ÄúI bless the rainsguess it rainssense the rain down in Africa‚Äù -Toto



True or False (torf())

True or False? You can permute values in a vector using sample(). TRUEFALSE



Longer MCQs (longmcq())
When your answers are very long, sometimes a drop-down select box gets formatted oddly. You can use longmcq() to deal with this. Since the answers are long, It‚Äôs probably best to set up the options inside an R chunk with echo=FALSE.
What is a p-value?

 the probability that the null hypothesis is true the probability of the observed, or more extreme, data, under the assumption that the null-hypothesis is true the probability of making an error in your conclusion

What is true about a 95% confidence interval of the mean?

 there is a 95% probability that the true mean lies within this range 95% of the data fall within this range if you repeated the process many times, 95% of intervals calculated in this way contain the true mean

title: Webexercises
text:
Checked sections
Create sections with the class webex-check to add a button that hides feedback until it is pressed. Add the class webex-box to draw a box around the section (or use your own styles).

title: Webexercises
text:
Hidden solutions and hints
You can fence off a solution area that will be hidden behind a button using hide() before the solution and unhide() after, each as inline R code. Pass the text you want to appear on the button to the hide() function.
If the solution is a code chunk, instead of using hide() and unhide(), simply set the webex.hide chunk option to TRUE, or set it to the string you wish to display on the button.

title: Webexercises
text:
Multiple Choice Question with Hints

What is the derivative of ( f(x) = x^2 )?

( 1 )

‚ùå Incorrect. The derivative of ( x^2 ) is not a constant.

üí° Hint: The power rule states ( x^n = n x^{n-1} ).

( 2x )

‚úÖ Correct! The derivative of ( x^2 ) is ( 2x ).

üéØ Why? The power rule gives ( x^2 = 2x ).

( x )

‚ùå Incorrect. You are missing a factor.

üí° Hint: When differentiating ( x^2 ), reduce the exponent by 1 and multiply by the original exponent.
